summary: This is an email chain from August 6, 2020, between officials at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR). The OPR is transmitting a draft report regarding the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in 2006-2008. The email discusses sharing the report with the 'Epstein team' for evaluation regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Handling of Epstein matter by SD Florida
events.description: The period under review by the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) regarding how the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida handled the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: OPR transmits draft report to SDNY
events.description: The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility sends its draft report on the SD Florida's handling of the Epstein matter to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.
personsInvolved: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) completed a draft report reviewing the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida from 2006-2008.
The draft OPR report was transmitted to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York on August 6, 2020.
Officials in the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office planned to share the OPR report with the 'Epstein team' to evaluate implications for the pending Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The email chain indicates internal DOJ review and coordination between different U.S. Attorney's Offices (SDNY and SD Florida) regarding the Epstein case history.
The formal OPR letter was sent from the DOJ's main address at 950 Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C.
